result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman in court for Phillip Rand Atwood. Defendant Phillip Rand Atwood in court. Court reviews case. Atty Zimmermna recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads N/C to Amended Count 1: PHYSICAL ABUSE OF CHILD- 948.03(3)(b). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court withholds conviction and enters DE into a 1.5 year DJOC. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:
    Count 1: 1.5 year DJOC.

Adjourned 08:46 AM

2:49 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Phillip Rand Atwood appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman appeared by video for Phillip Rand Atwood. Court reviews file. Atty Zimmerman doesn't anticipate any motions and states agreement reached, but needs time to complete COMPAS. Court sets Plea/Sentencing Hearing, but if not resolved, Court will allow Zoom appearances. Adjourned at 2:53 PM.  gll

10:53 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DF ATTY: Nicholas M Zimmerman, DF: Phillip Rand Atwood appeared. Court reviews case. WOPH: Atty Zimmerman notes this is going to be a waiver of PH. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Zimmerman request to continue with ARGN. ARGN:  Atty Zimmerman enters NG Plea. Waives Speedy Trial. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 11:00 AM  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
